title: version.bash and hg issues
body:
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull", "hg update default", rebuild, and
retry
what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. ./make.bash fails if hg is not installed
2. ./make.bash will silently fail versioning if hg is installed and there is no .hg tree
3.

6g

linux

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
d5785050f61d (release-branch.r59) release/release.r59

Please provide any additional information below.

I understand hg is the defacto standard for gaining the hg source tree. however there
must be a better way to gain version without having a hard build dependancy on hg? I
thought something like a $Id tag might be a solution for this one task? Or possible it
would be better to start having release tarballs for release tags only?
